Nobody, LITERALLY NOBODY:
SciShow: Robot Ant Swarms Have Arrived

Regarding the mechanical part, why was that presented as innovative? Unless I'm having false memories, I believe I've seen similar designs been studied during the 80s. One reason for why many robots use wheels, is that at the end of the day it happens to be the most efficient way (considering application). Not because we somehow overlooked or didn't study alternatives, for decades already. As for the swarm cooperation, that is neither really a new thing (also studies many times, decades ago). Granted, current hardware does provide more capacity than it used to do. Still, the way this is presented, to me comes across as a rather sad case of cultural amnesia (or historical ignorance), with researchers apparently trying to reinvent the wheel over and over again (well, maybe not quite .. but I'm sure they'll end up with using wheels in most use cases, again).
